definitions: in a way that shows pity and sorrow for someone else's misfortune

examples.text: she listened sympathetically to Lizzy's grievances
I smiled sympathetically at the mother

shortDefinitions: with expression or demonstration of sympathy

definitions: in a way that shows approval of or favor toward an idea or action

examples.text: the plea for restraint was treated sympathetically

shortDefinitions: with approval of or favour towards idea or action

definitions: in a way that attracts the liking of others

examples.text: supporters of the campaign were sympathetically portrayed

shortDefinitions: in way that attracts liking of others

definitions: in a sensitive or appropriate way

examples.text: the oak panelled lounge has been sympathetically restored
